name: saleratus
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a white chemical powder, potassium bicarbonate or sodium bicarbonate, that was added to bread and cakes in the past to make them rise when they were baked: The scones that she offered me had specks of saleratus on them. I added a teaspoonful of saleratus to the dough and kneaded it thoroughly.
More examplesFewer examplesSaleratus is not used as widely as bicarbonate of soda.The waitress brought me a cup of coffee with a saleratus biscuit in the saucer.I set out in the morning with a map, a compass, and a good supply of saleratus biscuits.
